alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:56PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Talladega, Calhoun and Cherokee Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 756 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rainsville to near Glencoe to near Leeds. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Talladega, Jacksonville, Piedmont, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Forney, West End-Cobb Town, Centre Municipal Airport, Cobb Town, Fort McClellan, Saks, Lincoln, Glencoe, Weaver, Riverside, Munford and Ohatchee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Alabama.
